_header: Into thy hands lord I take my soul
Subjects: scripture texts, Engl. trans. of; devotional verse
_description: In Manus Tuas — one stanza rhyme royal

BodRawB408.First Lines:
In to þi handes lorde I take my souleWhom þou boughtist
                    with þi bittur passion…
BodRawB408.Last Lines:
…Saue me fro payne and fro þe fendeAnd bring me to blis
                    þat hath none ende
BodRawB408.Editions:
Clark,  Andrew,
                        ed.  
             The English Register of Godstow Nunnery… c. 1450.
             3 vols. 
             EETS
         o. s. 129 (1905; repr. 1971); 130 (1906; repr. with 142, 1971); 142
            (1911; repr. 1971): 12.

BodDou229.First Lines:
[IN] to thi handes lord y betake my souleWhom thou boughtest with
                    thi bytter passione…
BodDou229.Last Lines:
…Saue me froo peyne & fro the fendeAnd bryng me to blisse
                    that neuer shal end
BodDou229.Editions:
MacCracken,  Henry Noble,
                        ed.  
             John Lydgate: The Minor Poems, Vol. I: Religious Poems.
EETS
         e.s. 107 (1911; repr. 1961): 376.
